required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effects of Exercise on the Cortical Silent Period in Prostate Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects of Exercise on the Cortical Silent Period in Prostate Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: In Canadian men, prostate cancer (PCa) is the most prevalent form of cancer and the third leading cause of cancer-related death. Unfortunately, PCa survivors are often burdened with feelings of anxiety and depression associated with the disease and associated treatments. Short-term exercise interventions (8-24 weeks) have improved psychosocial well-being in this population, but the impact of single bouts of exercise and related psychological or neurological changes have never been studied. The primary objective of the proposed study is to examine the effect of an acute bout of exercise on neurophysiological and psychological indicators of well-being in a randomized controlled trial (RCT) of 36 men with PCa. Participants will be randomly assigned to the intervention (60 min exercise) or control (60 min of television) and will undergo a brief neurological test (cortical silent period) and psychological questionnaires before and after their group assignment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Cortical Silent Period (CSP) Will be Determined Using Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) of the Motor Cortex.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').
primary_outcome.description: CSP is a measure of cortical inhibition that is negatively related to anxiety, stress, and depression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').
secondary_outcome.description: Correlations will be assessed between cortical silent period and acute mood state.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').
secondary_outcome.description: Correlations will be assessed between cortical silent period and acute anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale - Questionnaire(HADS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').
secondary_outcome.description: Correlations will be assessed between cortical silent period and acute anxiety and depression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').
secondary_outcome.description: Correlations will be assessed between cortical silent period and exercise-induced feelings.

arm_group.description: non-exercise control consisting of movie watching.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Eligible patients were approached for participation by a research coordinator from June to October, 2010. 86 eligible participants were approached for participation and 19 agreed (22% participation rate). Seventeen participants responded to the study poster. The 36 participants were randomly assigned to the exercise (n=18) or control (n=18) group.

group.title: Control (1hr of Viewing Emotionally Neutral Movie)
group.description: non-exercise control consisting of movie watching for 60 mins. the videos were short cartoon films considered to be emotionally neutral.

group.title: Exercise (1hr of Mixed-modality Exercise)
group.description: 1 hour of moderate intensity exercise. The session included 5- min warm-up, 25-min of resistance training, 25-min of aerobic training, and 5-min cool-down. Each session was led by a personal trainer and supervised by an exercise physiologist.

group.title: Control
group.description: non-exercise control consisting of movie watching.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Cortical Silent Period (CSP) Will be Determined Using Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) of the Motor Cortex.
outcome.description: CSP is a measure of cortical inhibition that is negatively related to anxiety, stress, and depression.
outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').

group.title: Control
group.description: non-exercise control consisting of movie watching.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Cortical Silent Period (CSP) Will be Determined Using Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) of the Motor Cortex.
measure.description: CSP is a measure of cortical inhibition that is negatively related to anxiety, stress, and depression.

outcome.title: Profile of Mood States Questionnaire(PoMS)
outcome.description: Correlations will be assessed between cortical silent period and acute mood state.
outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').

outcome.title: State-Trait Anxiety Inventory - Questionnaire(STAI)
outcome.description: Correlations will be assessed between cortical silent period and acute anxiety.
outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').

outcome.title: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale - Questionnaire(HADS)
outcome.description: Correlations will be assessed between cortical silent period and acute anxiety and depression.
outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').

outcome.title: Exercise-Induced Feelings Inventory - Questionnaire (EIFI)
outcome.description: Correlations will be assessed between cortical silent period and exercise-induced feelings.
outcome.time_frame: 10-15 minutes prior to the control/exercise condition ('pre-test') and 10-15 minutes after the control/exercise condition ('post-test').

reported_events.desc: Serious adverse and other adverse events were collected during participants' activity in the trial (i.e. the pre-treatment assessment, during the exercise or video sessions, and during the post-treatment assessment).

group.title: Control
group.description: non-exercise control consisting of movie watching.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
